fields.description: On jira.atlassian.com, I removed the "reporterusername=test-user" parameter from the POP service config, but still my replies by email are still being attributed to "issue creation tester".  It looks like JIRA may require a restart to pick up changed parameters.
fields.summary: Changing Service parameters does not take effect

fields.description:
I have installed JIRA 2.6.1 on Jetty 4.2.22 but it failed to run.  My database is PostgreSQL 8.0b3.  I followed the Jetty install doc to download the extra jars, modified entityengine.xml.  When Jetty starts the JIRA context, I get the following errors:

23:27:49.187 EVENT  file:/opt/jetty-4.2.22/webapps/jira/ anti-aliased to file:/opt/jira-professional-2.6.1/deployed-war/
23:27:49.983 EVENT  Started WebApplicationContext[/jira,Atlassian JIRA Web Application]
2004-10-03 23:27:50,705 WARN [atlassian.jira.upgrade.ConsistencyCheckImpl] Detected that you are using Tomcat or Websphere - turned off all transactions.
2004-10-03 23:27:51,604 ERROR [NoModule]
java.lang.SecurityException: sealing violation: can't seal package javax.naming: already loaded
       at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:234)
       at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:55)
       at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:194)
       at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
       at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:187)
       at org.mortbay.http.ContextLoader.loadClass(ContextLoader.java:197)
       at org.mortbay.http.ContextLoader.loadClass(ContextLoader.java:170)
       at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:302)
       at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredConstructors0(Native Method)
       at java.lang.Class.privateGetDeclaredConstructors(Class.java:1610)
       at java.lang.Class.getConstructor0(Class.java:1922)
       at java.lang.Class.newInstance0(Class.java:278)
       at java.lang.Class.newInstance(Class.java:261)
       at org.ofbiz.core.entity.TransactionFactory.getTransactionFactory(TransactionFactory.java:68)
       at org.ofbiz.core.entity.TransactionFactory.getConnection(TransactionFactory.java:99)
       at org.ofbiz.core.entity.ConnectionFactory.getConnection(ConnectionFactory.java:53)
...

Here here all Jetty's jars upon the request of Scott:

[root@hebron (/opt/jetty)]# find . -name "*.jar"
./ext/ant.jar
./ext/jasper-compiler.jar
./ext/jasper-runtime.jar
./ext/jcert.jar
./ext/jmxri.jar
./ext/jmxtools.jar
./ext/jnet.jar
./ext/jsse.jar
./ext/xercesImpl.jar
./ext/xml-apis.jar
./lib/javax.servlet.jar

./extra/lib/org.mortbay.jmx-jdk1.2.jar
./start.jar
./stop.jar
fields.summary: failed to install JIRA 2.6.1 on Jetty 4.2.22
Hardcode unicode encoding

fields.description:
There're a few IE cosmetic issues:

1. Issue Navigator filter menu does not fill out
2. Hidden fields causes unsightly borders at the top of a form. (currently seen in Create, Edit Issue, Clone issue, Create Issue.. Edit workflow.. Add new custom field option)
3. No borders for CustomField tables
4. Multi Select have double borders
5. Everything is centred in Browse Projects
fields.summary: Various IE bugs

fields.description:
If the date format has been customised and a date in the wrong format has been entered into the issue navigator, the error message has a hardcoded "d-MMM-yyyy" string in it.

Need to ask the user to enter the date in the format that has been specified in the jira-application.properties file.
fields.summary: IssueNavigator reports wrong format for dates when the date has been entered incorrectly.

fields.description: Login form where one is redirected to when authentication is needed has "Welcome To" instead of a localized string.
fields.summary: Missing i18n : login.jsp redirected when authen. needed

fields.description: Need to ensure that is centered vertically just like it is on Mozilla.
fields.summary: Logout screen on IE is not vertically centered.

fields.description: In the user picker showned when you "Specify User" in a filter request definition, the help baloon on users is not localized.
fields.summary: Missing i18n : help baloon in UserPicker popup
Allow default security level to be set per issue type

fields.description:
We currently have a single page of documentation covering all the database types:

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/standalone-dbconfig.html

We need to break these out into separate pages visible from the menu.

While doing this, we can probably also get rid of:

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/entityengine.html

Or at least, get it out of the menu.
fields.summary: Separate database installation guides

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4792].
  {panel}

From jira-user:

> 4) and last but not least, will a "near future" release of Jira offer a
> simplier way to customise user interface (for example : storing field
> height, field width, number of elements to display in a list, ability
> to associate a field with a tab [...])
fields.summary: Allow user to specify custom field display characteristics

fields.description:
If a simple html link is created to post data to CreteIssueDetails action with a project that does not allow anonymous issue reporting and the user is not logged in, an error is occur.

The preferred behaviour would be to redirect the user to to a login page (only if anonymous reporting is not allowed and the user is not logged) and then back to the CreateIssueDetails with all the passed parameters.
fields.summary: Cannot create direct links to CreateIssueDetails due to security violation.

fields.description:
Custom Fields must be unique

There is a limitation with the current custom fields that custom field names must be unique. This would be quite problematic for people wanting to create the same custom fields across multiple projects, among others. 

Currently this is required to make the Jelly tags work retrospectively.
fields.summary: Custom field names must be unique

fields.description:
Under application servers with lax XML parsers (eg. Resin), it is possible to export a JIRA backup that has non-Unicode characters, and so is invalid XML.  JIRA cannot import these files.  To work around this, we wrote a filter which strips out invalid characters before the parser gets to them.  This filter is enabled by setting the jira.exportimport.cleanxml in jira-application.properties.

Unfortunately under Tomcat (JIRA Standalone), enabling this flag causes imports to break with the message:

Exception occurred: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: [GenericDelegator.makeValue] could not find entity for entityName: ��tion

And in the log:

2004-10-06 11:14:12,533 INFO [jira.action.admin.DataImport] Importing using the SAX Parser
2004-10-06 11:14:12,538 INFO [jira.action.admin.DataImport] Start parsing XML with SAX Parser
2004-10-06 11:14:12,564 WARN [jira.action.admin.DataImport] Replaced invalid XML character  (0).
2004-10-06 11:14:12,564 WARN [jira.action.admin.DataImport] Replaced invalid XML character  (0).
2004-10-06 11:14:12,569 ERROR [ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator] Error getting entity definition from model
org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericModelException: Could not find definition for entity name ??tion
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.model.ModelReader.getModelEntity(ModelReader.java:300)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.getModelEntity(GenericDelegator.java:248)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.makeValue(GenericDelegator.java:408)
        at com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.ImportParser.startElement(ImportParser.java:79)
        at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.startElement(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractXMLDocumentParser.emptyElement(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanStartElement(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl$FragmentContentDispatcher.dispatch(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanDocument(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.parsers.DTDConfiguration.parse(Unknown Source)
fields.summary: jira.exportimport.cleanxml flag breaks import when using Tomcat

fields.description:
When trying to release a version, I stumble upon this error:
                                                                                                                            
Servlet error: No presentation file with name '/secure/project/views/editversionreleases.jsp' found!
                                                                                                                            
This jsp file doesn't exist in the 3.0 beta release.

fields.description:
Problem Description:
                                                                                                                            
NPE when jira send email for filter subscription.
                                                                                                                            
In tomcat log file, I have a bunch of com.atlassian.mail.MailException rooted at a NullPointerException.
                                                                                                                            
I did modified shared filters, changing them from global to a group of users.
                                                                                                                            
I have the impression that old subscriptions still refer to the previous definition ...
                                                                                                                            
Log file extract attached.
                                                                                                                            
Is there a workaround ?
                                                                                                                            
If you need more informations, don't hesitate to ask.
                                                                                                                            
Thanks,
Marc Paquette



2004-10-01 12:43:27,359 ERROR [atlassian.jira.mail.SubscriptionMailQueueItem]
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.jira.mail.SubscriptionMailQueueItem.sendSearchRequestEmail(SubscriptionMailQueueItem.java:87)
        at com.atlassian.jira.mail.SubscriptionMailQueueItem.send(SubscriptionMailQueueItem.java:70)
        at com.atlassian.mail.queue.MailQueueImpl.sendBuffer(MailQueueImpl.java:55)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailQueueService.run(MailQueueService.java:23)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainer.run(JiraServiceContainer.java:51)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:50)
        at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:147)
        at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:387)
fields.summary: NullPointer in SubscriptionMailQueueItem

fields.description:
We need a custom field that simply displays as an "Edit" link, which when pressed edits the issue concerned.  Other operations could be handled similarly.

> When I'm viewing a list of issues, I often wish to update a particular
> issue (e.g. assign it to another version).  In our current bug tracking
> system, there is a link "Edit" for each of the issues in the list. So I
> can simply click it, update the issue and I'm back at the list. In
> JIRA, I have to first to click on the issue, then press Edit link
> (which is, BTW is located in absolutely another place of the screen!),
> update the issue and then press "Return to search" (again is located in
> another place on the screen). That's much less convenient. I think
> adding this little "Edit" link for each issue would be a great
> improvement (and very easy to do!).
fields.summary: Custom field: issue operation links

fields.description:
This security hole enables users to package scripts into filters, which might then be executed by other users. Here is how to do it:

- Create a new filter
- Use as full text search following string: <script>alert('Hello Atlassian!')</script>
- Run the filter
- Save this filter
- see what happens?
- publish the filter to all other users and call it from another user
- scared?
fields.summary: Sceurity Issue: Filter allows Script excution

fields.description: The old webwork version used a subset tag - the new velocity version just shows all.
fields.summary: Assigned to me portlet does not limit issues

fields.description:
Hi
At ir regular intervals we are facing the JIRA instance not responding to the user requests.
Once we restart the application it is working fine.
But during the time when it is hanging we see teh following logs from the log file

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
SELECT ID, groupid, FIELDTYPE, FIELD, OLDVALUE, OLDSTRING, NEWVALUE, NEWSTRING FROM changeitem WHERE FIELD=? AND OLDSTRING=? ORDER BY groupid desc ([Microsoft][SQLServer 2000 Driver for JDBC][SQLServer]The text, ntext, and image data types cannot be compared or sorted, except when using IS NULL or LIKE operator.)
2004-10-05 01:56:18,789 WARN [core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor] [SQLProcessor.rollback]: SQL Exception while rolling back insert. Error was:java.sql.SQLException: [Microsoft][SQLServer 2000 Driver for JDBC]Object has been closed.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


I'm hear by attaching the log file and the entity engine.xml file
The Database it is running is on SQL Server and initially we were in HSQL and later migrated to SQL Server
fields.summary: Jira Instance hanging

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4778].
  {panel}

Our JIRA 2.6.1 currently has 70 projects. A dozen of them are loosely related, and lead by a single person. The poor chap has to run lots of saved searches to get a crisp view of what's going on in his projects.

Adding the ability to search issues belonging to projects lead by a specific user would be a great thing for him.

Another use-case in which such a feature is quite useful:

Sometimes, some of our project leaders go on vacation, or have to leave the office for several days without any mean nor time to connect to JIRA. 
In these cases, another person has to handle the projects. The backup leader then has to setup a few filters to search accross the relevant projects for activity. It would be much easier to be able to make a single search based on project leader.

Other ways to achieve similar results are JRA-2837 or JRA-2755
fields.summary: Allow searching for issues based on project leader

fields.description:
JIRA is an amazing tool. I'm pushing hard to migrate our defect/features system to JIRA (we're mostly developing C#/C++ solutions), but there's a blocker point : support for Visual SourceSafe aka VSS (switching cost for the VCM won't be accepted in my customer current context; I guess it's the same for many of .net based applications, although Subversion is gaining momentum).

Are there plan to implement support of VSS ?
fields.summary: Support for VSS (Visual Source Safe)

fields.description: The resolution of íssues with selection of a fixed version is not possible. It always blocks resolution by the errar message: Fix Version/s is required.
fields.summary: Resolution with Fix Version/s not possible

fields.description:
In the browse project view, in the right hand column, There is an issue overview containing critical/major/minor graphs. Clicking on these results in:

ERROR 
The project you are trying to view does not exist. Try browsing for projects. 

If you feel this message is wrong, please consult your administrators about getting the necessary permissions.
fields.summary: Open issue overview is not valid/links also

fields.description:
So if i look at user x, and he is in group y, y should be a link to :

http://jira.london.echonet/secure/admin/user/UserBrowser.jspa?emailFilter=&group=y
fields.summary: Make the group names in the user browser a link to a user by group filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4773].
  {panel}

If I'm attaching a file in JIRA, users get a message like this:

Jeff Turner updated JSP-259:
----------------------------

    Attachment: db2_ddl.sql


This means the attachment was created online, but there is nothing to indicate this to users, who could quite reasonably expect to see the attachment on their mail.  We could fix this quite easily by making the attachment filename a full URL.
fields.summary: Notification mails should have full URL of attachments

fields.description: Currently, JIRA's "Send support request" page sends an email to jira-support@atlassian.com. It would be better if it submitted a JIRA issue to http://support.atlassian.com via SOAP/XML-RPC. The page could then return to the user with a URL to the raised issue.
fields.summary: Log support requests on support.atlassian.com

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4771].
  {panel}

Various people want to be able to search by 'resolver'. From jira-user:

> Is there a way to search for a resolver of an issue?
> Our developers report for example which classes are changed by a fix and 
> then assign the issue to Quality Assurance.
> Later they have to apply this fix on older versions of our program and 
> would like to find again the issues they worked on.
fields.summary: Search by resolver

fields.description: If you look on j.a.c's browse project page, you'll see a huge "Category : JIRA Plugins" heading with one project, then a bit of whitespace, and then a list of other projects.  To reduce the visual effect that all projects are in the last category, we should list uncategorized projects first.
fields.summary: In Browse Project page, list categorized projects last

fields.description: On the CreateCustomField.jspa page, the default Search Template is "None".  Given the lack of explanatory text, users will not know what this field means and will leave it on its default value, assuming it to be a sensible default.
fields.summary: Custom fields default to having no search template

fields.description:
In french the noun and verb for "filter" are written differently : filtre:noun, filtrer:verb.

We would need a speparate property for this.
fields.summary: Distinct i18n property for "filter" button in user/group browsers

fields.description:
SaveFilter has many labels not localized.

Forget the comment in screenshot about reversing order for query summary field : it was a translation problem.
fields.summary: Missing i18n : many things not localized in SaveFilter

fields.description: The "No issue" part should be localized with common.concepts.noissues, I think.
fields.summary: Missing i18n : "Progression: No issue" in BrowseProject not localized

fields.description: Values for the drop downs in theConfigureReport screens are not localized.
fields.summary: Missing i18n : sort and limit-to drop down values are not localized when configuring reports

fields.description: In ConfigureReleaseNote, the default values for the 2 drop downs are not localized.
fields.summary: Missing i18n : version and style drop down default values not localized

fields.description: Title label and submit button not localized when closing an issue.

fields.description: See screenshot.
fields.summary: Not enough horizontal space between the yellow-square-bullet and label in manage portal

fields.description: Pre-defined filters in user profile not localized.

fields.description: The popup calendar for choosing a date is localized, but characters don't display correctly.  Maybe the character encoding is not properly specified ?

fields.description: Popup help on column titles of issue navigator not localized.

fields.description: Default value of drop-down for selecting a group not localized.

fields.description:
Label for number of portlets currently configured not localized.
Oddly enough, I remember that I did translate that :

./com/atlassian/jira/web/action/user/AddPortlet_fr.properties:4:addportlet.currentlyconfigured = <font color=003366>Présentement</font>: {0} sont configurés

That property got added with jira-translations-2004-10-03-2120; I guess that the modification was done in the code after 3.0 beta.
fields.summary: Missing i18n : configure dashboard

fields.description:
> Perhaps an enhancement would be to create multiple 'lead roles' for a project -
> ie currently there is lead developer, how about also lead BA, Tester, UAT, End
> User etc as well, to allow assignment to this abstract person at any step (ie
> the developer may not know who the lead tester is for that project, so just
> assign to lead tester). Not sure how this would work when the lead role user
> could change over time, I assume the lead developer function would just update
> any new assignments if the lead developer is changed?
fields.summary: Project roles

fields.description: Recipients and submit button not localized.
fields.summary: Missing i18n : filter subscription

fields.description: Title and submit button not localized.
fields.summary: Missing i18n : SavePortlet

fields.description: When an attachment is added from an email attachment, no change history entry is written.  This makes it impossible to determine which attachment is associated with which comment.
fields.summary: Attachments added by email not recorded in change history

fields.description: Makes using support site quite hard :)
fields.summary: Email notifications don't include custom field details anymore

fields.description: At the moment it's impossible to tell when someone creates an issue whether or not they have attached a file to it. That's not good :)
fields.summary: Create email (and other emails?) should include attachment details

fields.description:
I'm not sure how this occurs, but I've just seen this on Safari. Checking the HTML the <select> tags are there. Could be a Safari rendering bug (doubtful?) but I'll log it here anyway in case anyone else notices it.

I've attached a screenshot.
fields.summary: Rendering bug under Safari?

fields.description:
We sometimes dont want our customers to see who is actually working on what item, as some bad customers then tend to talk directly to the developers (which is in many cases not very good) and overgo the project lead, which he is supposed to talk to.

What i would propose is a new permission in the permission sheme, called "Sees Assignee".

As an alternative you could couple this permission together with the permission to assign someone.
fields.summary: Hide "Assignee" from certain user groups

fields.description: The online help (all these little nice help buttons) is not localized. It would help a  lot having these documents localized and working with the help-Buttons.
fields.summary: Localized Online Help

fields.description:
We implented our jira-installation in germen and fitted it to our corporate design. (many other people have done this also - believe me!)

When you click the online-help link you get to the online-help of atlassian which is NOT localized and has a totally different look. This is not very good from the usability point of view, isn`t it?

I suggest the following things:
1. Make the link for online help-configurable, so every installation can link to its own online help
2. alternative: create a switch, so that i can switch all these help-button off
fields.summary: Online Help Button redirection or diasbling

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4742].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days.

Improving notifications in JIRA is a key area that we intend to address as soon as possible. It's important to us that we not only improve JIRA notifications, but also work towards more consistency between JIRA and other Atlassian applications like Confluence and Bitbucket.

While we can't provide a concrete timeline, rest assured that this is something we are actively thinking about this across Atlassian and plan to invest in as soon as it's feasible.

It's important to understand that we rarely try to implement individual features from jira.atlassian.com, but instead take a holistic look at the problem and use feedback from the comments here and a [dozen other sources|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com] of customer input to solve the core problems.

Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions or feedback.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

Being able to create notication groups based by "Issue Type".

let's say for example I would like to create an issue type "Business Feature", and have a group of people "Business Feature Group", so when any issue related to "Business Feature" type is created etc... notification is sent to the group "Business Feature Group".
and so on...
fields.summary: Being able to create notification groups based on "Issue Type"

fields.description:
Here is the scenario:

We have a project setup that 26 clients will be logging issues into. We have a group and userid setup for each of the 26 clients as well as a helpdesk group for all users who will be responding to the requests. 

We do not want clients from agency 1 to be able to see issues created by clients from agency 2 and vice versa. Without creating a sepearte project for each agency and assigning a permission scheme to that project limiting visiblity of those tickets to that agency and the helpdesk group, is there another way to setup security so only the user(specific user id) who created the issue, and all members of the helpdesk group can view issues?
fields.summary: Limit visibility of new issues

fields.description:
Here is the french language translation for jira 3 beta, sync'ed up with jira-translations-2004-10-03-2120.

There are still some text not localized, but I will report these separately.

Savourez, commentez, chialez même, mais exprimez-vous ! :-)
fields.summary: French 3.0 translation

fields.description: If you chose "open" the name of the file to be downloaded is "issuenavigator.jspa", which might by kind of confusing to some users. Nicer would be a name like "XML_export.xml" or "export.xml" or something like this.
fields.summary: XML Filename is not very well named

fields.description:
When a user uses quick search and types a term which is only used in issues to which the user doesn't have access, then the appliation behaves in a strange way. 

Sometimes it returns "no results found". Which is probably the correct behaviour, since the user doesn't have access to the supposed-to-be-found hits. On the other hand, sometimes it returns a "system error" in the case of hits to which the user doesn't have access.

The log file shows: 

2004-09-24 13:44:13 ErrorDispatcherValve[localhost]: Remote Client Aborted Request, IOException: Broken pipe
fields.summary: strange behaviour for quick search hits when user doesn't have permission

fields.description:
Hi,

We have 2 dimension-filter portlet with in X-axis the issue statuses and in Y-Axis the "fix for" versions. The associated filter is working fine and it is showing all our statuses. However the portlet does not show all statuses (some of them are aggregated with other statuses).

In other words, the filter has issues in statuses that do not appear in the portlet. However counting all the issues for all statuses, we reach the same number as in the filter itself. It's just that some statuses are aggregated together.

Any idea? Any known bug?

Thanks
fields.summary: Two dimension filter error with custom statuses

fields.description:
When attaching a screenshot, although the process is successful, there is no indication.  So people are adding screenshots multiple (up to 5) times, before closing the window, and seeing that they have many identical attachments.

(and then they can't delete them, but that's reported elsewhere)
fields.summary: Attach screenshot works - but acts like it fails
Filters should allow dates relative to Today

fields.description:
exported our data from JIRA 2.6.1 then imported into a standalone 3.0 beta as a test, received an exception. [INFO] QuartzScheduler - -Scheduler JiraQuartzScheduler_$_NON_CLUSTERED paused. 2004-10-03 13:24:58,988 INFO [jira.action.admin.DataImport] Importing using the SAX Parser 2004-10-03 13:24:58,988 INFO [jira.action.admin.DataImport] Start parsing XML wi th SAX Parser 2004-10-03 13:24:59,191 ERROR [jira.action.admin.DataImport] org.xml.sax.SAXPars eException: Character reference "�" is an invalid XML character. java.io.CharConversionException: Last Entity imported :[GenericEntity:ChangeItem ][oldvalue,5][group,10173][newvalue,6][field,status][oldstring,Resolved][newstri ng,Closed][id,10257][fieldtype,jira]
Character reference "�" is an invali d XML character. at com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.DataImport.processException(DataImpor t.java:199) at com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.DataImport.doExecute(DataImport.java: 91) at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:151) at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport .java:49) at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraNonWebActionSupport.execute(JiraNonWebA ctionSupport.java:27) at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher. java:131) at com.atlassian.core.action.DefaultActionDispatcher.execute(DefaultActi onDispatcher.java:34)
fields.summary: Importing JIRA 2 data into 3.0 causes an exception thereby blocking our migration

fields.description:
The portlets used to be linked, but with the new stats portlets, they aren't.

We need to do the two dimensional stats portlets, as well as the project & normal stats portlet, as well as the single level group-by report.
fields.summary: Stats Portlets & reports need to be linked to issue navigator

fields.description: Error messages when in the filter pages are english only.
fields.summary: Error messages when manipulating filters are not localized.

fields.description:
How can we localize text from the plugins ?

For example, in atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/default/com/atlassian/jira/plugins/reports/timetracking.properties there is some text that should be localized.  If I create the file named
atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/fr_FR/com/atlassian/jira/plugins/reports/timetracking_fr.properties
following the convention for all other properties files to translate, text is still in english.
fields.summary: Plugins not localizable ?

fields.description:
Title attribute of IMG tag for help in 
atlassian-jira-enterprise-3.0-beta-standalone/atlassian-jira/template/standard/help.jsp 
is hard-coded in english (see line 19 in help.jsp).
fields.summary: Missing i18n for help tooltip

fields.description:
click on browse project
choose a project
on the right, under project summary, the open issues are sorted by priority.
click on one of the priorities (e.g. 'Major')

ERROR 
The project you are trying to view does not exist. Try browsing for projects. 

If you feel this message is wrong, please consult your administrators about getting the necessary permissions. 

I am logged in as the system administrator, so I doubt it's really permissions.
fields.summary: Clicking on open issues by priority in browse project results in error

fields.summary: Stacktrace displayed on dashboard

fields.description:
I am executing the following Jelly Script. JIRA says it completes succesfully, but when i check the user browser, there is no user created. What goes wrong?

Here is the script:

<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.JiraTagLib">
<!--
<jira:CreateUser username="boel" password="xxx" confirm="xxx" fullname="Boelmann, Wolfgang" email="Wolfgang.Boelmann@hec.de"/>
-->
</JiraJelly>
fields.summary: Executing Script completes succesfully, but has no effect

fields.description:
Someone really needs to use IE on the JIRA team :) Or at least use it for a few days coming up to the beta.

I just noticed this today while testing the P4 plugin. See attached screenshot.

Also, there's some very funky CSS stuff going on in 3.0 (watch the logout link in the top right).
fields.summary: Bugs in IE

fields.description:
I have added a new user to our jira system as member of the group X. An e-mail was sent with the URL of the login and the password.

Our customer clicked the URL in the e-mail. A list of issues from a project P was shown WITHOUT ANY LOGIN! The project P has no relation to the group X, so even after a correct login the user should not be able to see issues from this project.

The list of issues was no regular search result. The displayed (broken) page startet with the lines
=============
"value="">
">
">
" tabindex=4>
=============
followed by a list of issues of the project P.
fields.summary: Unauthorized access to issues possible!

fields.description: I tried to delete some attachments (pictures) one of them (cal.gif) throws the error shown at the attached file.
fields.summary: removing of one attachment not possible

fields.description:
Here's updated translation with all that new strings added. Also I reviewed a lot of old messages to make more user-friendly and more close to russian grammar.

Sorry I haven't done CRLF->CR translation yet.
fields.summary: updated russian translation for 3.0 Beta

fields.description: I would like to edit or delete a work log done entry in the event that I have logged the wrong spent time. In 2.6.1 I have no chance to correct a wrong entry once I have committed the work log.
fields.summary: Allow to edit a work log done entry

fields.description:
Cascading style sheet is sometimes not applied in issue Navigator view. 

Please see attachements (html source code send by Jira server) :

1) Normal_case.txt : html source code received for "ok" issue Navigator view
2) No_Css_case.txt : html source code received for "ko" issue Navigator view
fields.summary: CSS not applied in issue Navigator view

When logging out JIRA dies with:

java.lang.NullPointerException

(Shown on the error page in browser. Nothing appears in the log.)

I believe this could be due to jira being deployed with a context path other than "/".
fields.summary: Logout problem
When closing an issue, you cannot select the 'none' version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4716].
  {panel}

There is a common Microsoft-esque mail client out there that does not use >'s to quote, but rather appends the whole original mail, eg:

-----Original Message-----
From: Jeff Turner (JIRA) [mailto:jira-support-system@atlassian.com]
Sent: 01 October 2004 00:28
To: .....
Subject: ....
.....


We should improve the Non quoted comment handler to recognize text after '-----Original Message-----' as quoted, and strip it.
fields.summary: Non-quoted Comment Handler should parse Microsoft quoting format

fields.description: It would be great to have a custom field that extracts the end part of the reporter's email address.  Eg. for this issue, its value would be 'atlassian.com' (from jeff@atlassian.com).  One could then find all issues raised by people from a certain company.
fields.summary: New custom field: reporter's company (email hostname)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4714].
  {panel}

h3. Symptoms

When using the [Database Integrity Checker|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+the+Database+Integrity+Checker] a stack trace is generated.

The following may be found within the {{atlassian-jira.log}}:

{noformat}
com.atlassian.jira.appconsistency.integrity.exception.IntegrityException: Error occurred while performing check.
	at com.atlassian.jira.appconsistency.integrity.check.WorkflowCurrentStepCheck.doCheck(WorkflowCurrentStepCheck.java:142)
	at com.atlassian.jira.appconsistency.integrity.check.WorkflowCurrentStepCheck.preview(WorkflowCurrentStepCheck.java:51)
	at com.atlassian.jira.appconsistency.integrity.IntegrityChecker.preview(IntegrityChecker.java:63)
	at com.atlassian.jira.appconsistency.integrity.IntegrityChecker.previewWithIds(IntegrityChecker.java:35)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.IntegrityChecker.doExecute(IntegrityChecker.java:68)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:165)
{noformat}

h3. Cause

This is a bug within JIRA.

h3. Workaround

Run the "Check Issue for Relation 'RelatedOSWorkflowEntry'" check first and fix any entries that are returned.
fields.summary: Integrity checker preview breaks when issues have missing workflows

fields.description: Log in again link after logging out is broken
fields.summary: Log in again link after logging out is broken

fields.description: If a user clicks on the "Version Control" tab while the CVS service is currently parsing the log, another parse is scheduled.  This potentially leads to the situation where JIRA is continually parsing, and the CVS tab never available.
fields.summary: Clicking CVS tab reparses log if currently parsing

fields.description: On the Browse Project page, we used to have stats on the right, giving issue counts per status.  This is broken, since the getOpenIssuesByStatus method has been deleted from StatisticsAccessorBean
fields.summary: No stats by status on Browse Project page

fields.description:
In JIRA select lists, we often have 'header' entries, like 'Unreleased Versions', which are not real options and should not be selected.  Unfortunately users do not know this, and get errors when selecting these.

We should use the disabled="true" attribute in the relevant <option> tags to make header options not selectable.
fields.summary: Don't allow selection of 'Unreleased' or 'Released' headers

fields.description:
When not logged in

/secure/CreateIssue!default.jspa 

The 'Next' button should be removed if they're not logged in.

Create Issue
Step 1 of 2: Choose the project and issue type...
Form Errors:
An exception occurred: java.lang.NullPointerException.
 
You are not logged in, and do not have the permissions required to browse projects as a guest.
fields.summary: Next button appears when not logged in

fields.description: The help links on jira/secure/admin/ViewFieldLayoutSchemes.jspa and following pages do not link to help on this topic, but rather to Jira's documentation overview.
fields.summary: No documentation how to use and configure custom field schemes

fields.description:
The workaround is to delete the condition/validator/function and re-add it with new parameters.

The workaround does not work in all cases as some functions cannot be deleted (see JRA-4677).
fields.summary: Cannot edit conditions, validators and post functions after they have been added to a workflow transition

fields.description:
Please see CONF-1459.

The problem also applies to JIRA as well.
fields.summary: Please upgrade Tomcat version used for building standalone distribution

fields.description:
the emitted html references <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" media="print" href="/styles/global_printable.css"> (among other things), but it seems clear that it should be global_printable.css.jsp. Without the application of the stylesheet, the page uses default Times New Roman... making the page quite crowded.

cool product otherwise!
fields.summary: stylesheets are not applied properly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4704].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 13 Jan 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; however there are no immediate plans to put this suggestion on our near term roadmap.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Daniel Franz
dfranz at atlassian dot com
Principal Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
  

Current Custom Fields do not allow CF to be individually configured. For example, one might want a User Picker custom field to be limited to users of a particular group.

You should be able to pass in parameters to configure the custom field when you set it up initially.
fields.summary: Configurable Custom Fields

fields.description:
JIRA 3 has a new custom field system, and we need some sort of tutorial document taking the user through the process of writing a custom field.  Some possibilities for a worked example:

 - A CF that exposes something in the change history (eg. first record - Bugzilla import id?)
 - A CF containing the user who last commented
 - A CF that shadows an arbitrary field, but only makes it visible to certain users
 - A new CF type (eg. boolean checkbox field).
 - A CF that exposes a value from an external database (eg. looking up customer details for the issue reporter, or mapping JIRA keys to work orders).
fields.summary: Document how to create new custom fields

fields.description:
Open Issues by Priority in the Browse Project page does not work.

Browse for a project. Click a priority on the right hand side. Page displays:

"The project you are trying to view does not exist. Try browsing for projects."
fields.summary: Open Issues by Priority in the Browse Project page does not work

fields.summary: Error migrating issues?
Improve Support for ITIL Processes
POP3-Authentication before SMTP

fields.description:
I understand why it is there - for descriptions of the other tabs
.
But, wouldnt the descriptions be better off as tooltips on the tab links?
fields.summary: "Select" Tab is quite redundant on BrowseProject

fields.description:
It is currently not possible to send email notifications on a custom workflow transition. This makes the custom workflow feature almost not useable.

It would be good to add custom events in notification schemes that map to the custom transitions.
fields.summary: Add custom notification events to support email notification of custom workflow steps
